basics.name: HUGO ENRIQUE GOMEZ PEREZ
basics.label: Software Architect
basics.summary: MCS on artificial intelligence applied to education And Computer Science Engineer. Experienced in full-stack development for more than 6 years, building solutions for the government, national and international companies. He has earned a lot of knowledge by making architectural decisions on components that affected more than 100k users and by selecting the right coding styles, frameworks and development process for the whole programming department (over 400 developers).

work.summary: I am in charge of setting the programming standards in the Java language, Android platform and Security guidelines in the development process. My responsibilities include selecting the right technical tools for developers, best code organization, style, frameworks and libraries. I am also in charge of defining the selection, classification and promotion of the programmers in the entire company (over 400 developers)
highlights: Created an Authorization architecture that removed the need of recompiling components on permission changes, reducing the number of incident reports by 30%
Introduced TDD and database mocking in C#, reducing a system configuration time from 3 days to 5 minutes

Developed a C++ Database Connection API based on OTL template framework, this completely removed the maintainability changes and errors when a table field changed, as the types where dynamically generated

Created a component to replace Java Applets that allowed the Web to use Biometric Sensor Autentication, this helped 500+ systems to get out of the compatibility problem in browsers and simplified the process

Created a Netbeans project template that included the jersey framework and the necessary packages to rapidly start making a micro-service in a standard way, this allowed programmers from different teams to work on the same way, making communication, straightforward
Attended JavaOne2016 Conference in San Francisco, bringing state of the art knowledge to the company
Introduced the Android standards to the company and established libraries like GreenDAO, EventBus, ButterKnife as the solid foundation for every project, this decreased development time and bugs
Settled the Java and Android Coding Styles, making the code reviews easier as we implemented SonarQube to automatically check coding standards
Taught the Java and Android courses in the company, influencing 100+ employees into better coding practices
Created a python component that allowed Linux OS to use biometric authentication on web pages, solving a 20 year old problem in the company
Design and implementation of a Core API to evaluate the skills of programmers and architects in order to better classify personal

work.summary: I was a Software Developer for the 2013 election's system in the Sinaloa region, I was also the maintenance lead, this meant that for every request for modification, I was in charge of selecting the right programmer for the feature.
highlights: Managed to deliver on time the 2013 Sinaloa Elections System
Created an algorithm for the polling stations required for the entire Sinaloa State, based on geographical data
Maintenance leader, in charge of canalizing the changes to the appropriate programmer
Query Optimizations across the system to fulfill the quality standards, average query time reduced from 5 min to < 30 ms
Successful implementation of a phonegap project, deploying on both IOS and Android
Worked under pressure to deliver the project on time ( 10 - 36 hrs shifts)

highlights: Technical presentations to IT managers of the most important enterprises in Culiacan
Demo and production installation of solutions, including VMware VSphere, Symantec Endpoint, Citrix Server
Technical problem resolution to clients
